revised_title: Pulsating Flow and Solute Dispersion in a Tube: A Study on Effective Dispersion Coefficients
tldr: This article investigates the effective dispersion coefficient of a solute in pulsating flow through a tube. The author focuses on viscous flow under a pulsating pressure gradient and finds that the Taylor diffusion coefficient contains terms proportional to the square of the amplitude of the pressure pulsations. However, the coefficients of these terms tend to zero rapidly, and the effect of pulsation rarely contributes more than (the ratio of the amplitude of pressure gradient pulsation to mean pressure gradient)^2 to the total dispersion coefficient.
